variant.question: Kepler's second law states that the

options.text: radius vector Sun Earth-sweeps out equal areas in equal time.
area swept out by the radius vector Sun-Earth per hour increases with increasing length of the radius vector.
radius vector Sun-Earth moves at constant angular speed.
length of the radius vector Sun-Earth is directly proportional to the square root of its angular speed.
the meridians and the parallels of latitude intersect at right angles and when the scale from any selected point is the same in all directions.
the meridians are straight lines and the scale is constant.
when it conforms to the specifications.
the variation information is printed on the map as isogonals.

variant.question:
Which of the following statements most accurately describes a great circle track on a Lambert chart?
A straight line will approximate to a great circle...

options.text: if the straight line is close to the parallel of origin.
if the great circle track is a curve concave to the parallel of origin.
if the straight line follows the parallel of origin.
if the sine of the parallel of origin corresponds to the convergence factor.

variant.question: Which of the following statements most accurately describes a great circle route on a Lambert conformal conic chart? A straight line will approximate to a great circle course if the...

options.text: straight line is close to the parallel of origin.
straight line follows the parallel of origin.
great circle course is a curve concave to the parallel of origin.
sine of the parallel of origin is equal to the convergence factor.
